summary: This is a brief internal memo from the Chief Psychologist at the Metropolitan Correctional Center regarding Jeffrey Epstein's cell conditions. It instructs staff to move Epstein to a different cell upon his return from an attorney conference because the toilet in his current cell is broken.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the memo; an inmate at the Metropolitan Correctional Center who is to be moved from a cell with a broken toilet.

events.title: Epstein's Cell Transfer Request
events.description: The Chief Psychologist at MCC issues a request to move Jeffrey Epstein to a different cell upon his return from an attorney conference because the toilet in his current cell (Psych Observation area, cell #4) is not working correctly.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: On July 28, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein was held in the Psych Observation area of the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.
Epstein's cell (#4) had a broken toilet that was not correctly working.
Prison staff were instructed to move Epstein to a different cell after he returned from an attorney conference.
The document is an internal memo from the facility's Chief Psychologist, indicating concern over inmate living conditions.
